statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Darrius Garrett set a Richmond and Atlantic 10 Conference record with 14 blocked shots and Kevin Anderson scored nine points in overtime as the Spiders topped Massachusetts 70-63 on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Richmond stops UMass with team-record 17 blocks
article.linkText: Garrett's 14 blocks set Richmond,  A-10 record
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- Darrius Garrett set a Richmond and Atlantic 10 Conference record with 14 blocked shots and Kevin Anderson scored nine points in overtime as the Spiders topped Massachusetts 70-63 on Wednesday night. The Spiders (13-5, 2-1 Atlantic 10) finished with a team-record 17 blocks. David Gonzalvez started the overtime period with a 3-pointer and Anderson followed with a pair of field goals, the second for three points for a 62-58 lead. The Minutemen (7-9, 1-2) could get no closer as Richmond hit 10 of 12 free throws in overtime. Anderson finished with 19 points and Gonzalvez 16 for Richmond. Garrett also grabbed 13 rebounds. Freddie Riley scored 20 points and Ricky Harris 18 to lead Massachusetts. It was Harris' 26th straight double-figures scoring game. Neither team led by more than five points in the second half, which included five ties and five lead changes.
